page.title: 05TOURISM - GODSHILL
page.content: Godshill is a compact village of approximately 1100 people. The main industry is tourism, there being 5 tea gardens, 2 restaurants, 7 gift shops, Herb Cottage, Natural History Museum,Bird Garden - all of thewm echoed in the Model Village in the Old Vicarage Gardens. The large car parks barely cope with the enormous numbers of cars and coaches that descend on the village on a summer day. A count at 14.30 on 17.6.85 revealed 130 cars, 15 coaches, 2 caravans, bringing an estimated 1150 visitors. The village has preserved its old stone cottages - many still thatched. Probably the most photographed village in England, it appears on jig-saws, calendars,TV etc.But in late Autumn it reverts to its alter ego,a tightly-knit unit full of lively associations.
